text: I'm going to show you the secret source of how to make your mixes sound warmer, fuller and just overall better.
It's one of the easiest ways to add character and energy to your sound.
So what are we waiting for? Let's dive in.
Saturation is basically controlled distortion.
It brings out all the hidden harmonics in your instruments.
And by adding this harmonic content, your mix suddenly sounds richer, thicker and more alive.
There are two main types of saturation.
Each brings unique qualities to your mix.
The first one is odd order harmonics.
They add excitement and energy to your tracks by introducing harmonics at odd multiples of the fundamental frequency.
This is perfect for drums, electric guitar and bass where you want to create impact and cut through the mix.
The second is even order harmonics.
These produce smoother, warmer, more rounded tones.
They add richness and depth by generating harmonics at even multiples of the fundamental frequency.
This is ideal for vocals, pianos and acoustic guitars when you want to add to their natural character without making them sound harsh.
Now let's talk about plugins because let's be honest, we all love a good plugin, don't we?
